intro: Vilfa rigens, commonly known as the rigid vilfa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, emitting a subtle scent when crushed. Vilfa rigens is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
